runs.comm: What a start by Gayle. He leaned into the full delivery outside off to ease it through wide mid-off
bangs it short of length and it sits up outside off, Gayle flat-bats it and M Hussey dives to his left at extra cover to prevent the boundary.
And so Gayle goes over the Australians. Another slightly short delivery, he rocked back to get it up and over backward point for a cracking four
goes round the stumps to slip in a slower one, Gayle gets his front leg up to swat it past square leg
full and moving away from the off stump, Fletcher walks into the drive and is beaten.
full again, on the off stump line, Fletcher goes for the big hit, drags it towards mid-on
Fletcher goes down town. He picked the length delivery from the off stump and heaves it over mid-on

Almost one-handed six over square leg! It was back of length delivery, bouncing on the middle stump line, Fletcher cleared the front foot and swung it over the infield. The bottom hand started to come off the handle before going back into the grip.
round-arms this down the leg side for a wide
the slower one this time and Fletcher is way too early into the intended swing over mid-on and misses it completely
after making room for the previous few deliveries, he shuffles into the line this time and pushes the full delivery to right of mid-on for a single
full and straight, on the off stump line, defends to the off side
on a length, around the off stump, Gayle, with that spread out stance, neither goes forward or back, just holds balance to punch it back to the bowler
screamer! Fletcher moved fractionally outside leg and cut the short-of-length pacy delivery past point. Not a man move, as they say in the Caribbean
Lee goes for the slow bouncer, that we saw Taylor bowl so well, Fletcher gets inside the line to tap it to leg slip region, runs off the body
short in length, just outside off stump, Gayle goes for the pull but doesn't connect as it was another slow short-pitched delivery
banged in short of length, kicks up just outside off, Gayle is cramped up but some how manages to arch back and flat-bat it over cover
Lee with the slow short-one, Fletcher is made to wait and he tries to flat-bat it over mid-off but doesn't connect well and it drops well short of mid-off
145.8 kmph yorker outside off, dug out to backward point
drifts it towards the leg stump from round the stumps, Gayle helps it along with a swat-pull and the ball races to the deep backward square leg boundary
121.2 kmph slower one outside off, Fletcher chipped in with the almighty swing over mid-on but no wood on leather
Fletcher loves his walking airy drives. He moved forward to kill a full length delivery over mid-off, his back leg was in the air as he completed the shot

dropped by Michael Hussey at mid-on. Fletcher with another walking drive , but got under the ball too much and the ball ballooned over mid-on. Michael back-pedaled but it appears didn't even get a touch as the ball swirled past his fingers. Ian Bishop, on air, provides more drama. Unsure who the fielder was - whether it was David or Michael - he screams, "It's a Hussey!"
opens the bat-face to run it down to third man

almost run out but Mitch can't fire in the direct hit. It was pushed towards the off side and they ran for the single. Johnson went after it, picked, turned and fired the throw but the ball bounced over the stumps at the non-striker's end
One mighty wallop! He cleared the front hit and thwacked it high and over midwicket. Into the school beyond the boundary. What a whack that was.
yorker around the off stump, dug out to the off side

Oh boy what a violent six this was .. Immense fun ... It was the slower one but he picked it up early, waited for it, cleared the front foot and killed it over long-on. Hope the school kids are not wandering around the stadium. It crashed into the roof .. what a big big hit ....
he moves towards off, comes back into position to dig out a yorker to the off side

Violence refuses to abate at The Oval. Gayle is wreaking havoc. Lee, from round the stumps this time, serves one full delivery outside off and Gayle crashes it over covers in his inimitable style. What's more, it's a free hit too

That has almost decapitated Fletcher. It was full and outside off, Gayle murdered it past the startled Fletcher who dived to the ground. Blink. The ball is picked up from the long-off boundary. Lee is bleeding here. What can he do to stop this man?

As it turns out, he can do nothing but watch Gayle dismiss him everywhere around the ground.  It was a short delivery, Gayle opened up his stance, kept his front foot outside leg and smashed it high into the midwicket stands.The white ball is flying all over.
Fletcher is not going to sit quiet and watch. He started this mayhem.  Bracken drifts to the pads and Fletcher plays a neat little flick shot to deep backward square leg boundary.
leans forward to push it to the off side
110.8 kmph slow dibbly seamer outside off, pushed down to mid-off
yorker length, pushed towards short mid-on for a quick single
another yorker, dug out and it bounces off the turf over Bracken and Fletcher calls Gayle over for a single
wide down the leg side, Haddin under-arms a throw back, trying to catch Gayle out of the crease but the man is firmly entrenched inside
moves to 48 with a cracking square cut. It was the slower one but Gayle waited for it to arrive before bending his knees to hold balance and flashing the ball past point
length delivery just outside off, Fletcher stays adjacent to the line and chops it down to third man
well outside off stump and it's a wide
Another wide. Bowling to Gayle can make you do stuff like this
full one outside off, eased down to long-off
banged in short and into the body of Fletcher, who gets cramped up but goes for the one-handed pull and edges it to fine leg
jabs it to the on side for a single.

That's his fifty, reached with a drive to long-off. The crowd are on their feet celebrating. What a mad little dashing innings this has been. Full value for their money. Even the pigeons have flown in close for a ring-side view.
swatted past square leg for a single
yorker to start the over, pushed down to long-on for a single
beaten by the slower one outside off. Gayle lunged out in the end but couldn't put bat to ball.
full toss on the middle, eased past the bowler for a single
fab on drive. He backed away a touch to play a lovely whipping on drive to wide long-on. Superb piece of timing.
slower one again, Fletcher shuffled across, waited for the ball to arrive before wristing it past square leg
leans forward to turn it to square leg for a single
just outside off stump, runs it down to third man
driven through the field for a single. 67 to win from 70 balls
That calpyso style pull .. front leg goes in the air and the bat comes down on the ball .. just a single, though this time
slanted full outside off stump, Gayle tried to lift it over the on side but ended up edging it to the on side of the pitch
fullish delivery, Gayle drives even as Hopes slips and  tumbles at the other end and the ball crashes into his back ... ouch! Luckily for him it didn't hit his head ...
Hopes slips and falls again! Hmm ... Gayle flicks it off his hips for a single
The Greeks must be hopping in joy now! Oh this game must be all too easy ... Gayle steps out and lifts it straight over to yet another boundary ...
leans forward to push it to the off side
leans across to turn the full one to midwicket
Floated full outside off stump and I don't think Gayle hit it cleanly ... Er .. try telling that to David. It sailed comfortably over long-off for yet another six
charges out toinside-out  loft it to wide  long-off where Mitch makes a diving stop
pushed towards Ponting at mid-off and sets off for a quick single. Ponting fires in a direct hit and it's referred upstairs. Not out is the verdict. Gayle had just about dragged his bat inside .
short in length, on the middle stump line, Gayle takes the bottom-hand off the handle as he stabs the ball to the off side of the pitch for a single
full pitched, driven to the off side
really full up to the bat, driven to Lee at long-off
just short of the blockhole, outside off, pushed to cover point
Moves to 49 with a flashing square cut. He moves outside leg and plays a feisty cut past the diving backward point
stays on 49 as his cover drive finds the fielder
Gayle is in pain. It was a full delivery, that got a inner edge and hit him on the flesh just below the thigh pad ... he hobbles across for a single and he is now down on the ground ..
Fletcher reaches his fifty with a imperious flat-batted heave over wide mid-on. Gayle congratulates him, and so does the crowd ..

But he is gone now. He went for the pull from outside off but the ball bounced more and ballooned up close on the off side for a simple catch. What a fine innings from Fletcher. He started the assault before Gayle took over
driven cleanly and powerfully to mid-off.. half-stop there
bangs it short, Marshall hops to push it down past backward point
short and outside off stump, chopped down to backward point .. Gayle would feel he has missed out on a four there
slightly short in length, outside off, tapped to third man
tries to carve a full length delivery outside off, bottom-edges it to the keeper
full pitched outside off, driven down to long-off
the bouncer but  well down the leg side ...
almost yorker length, Marshall drives to long-on for a single
slower ball outside off, Gayle takes the bottom-hand off the handle as he adjusts to the change of pace and slices the ball through covers
floated full, driven down the ground to long-on
outside off, full, driven to long-off for yet another single
And again, down to the same fielder ..
Thump! Gayle waltzes down the track and lofted it straight over the bowler and it kept flying on and on ....
fuller, on the middle, dug down the ground past the bowler
goes right back to work it past square leg and they run hard to come back for the second
full delivery on the middle, Gayle is in a tangle, trying to turn it to the on side and gets a leading edge but falls safely at the mid-off region
another edge .... as Gayle slices the full delivery over cover point, just ahead of the fielders running back from the 30-yard circle

And Gayle's fabuliciously violent innings comes to an end. He has a laugh with Lee as he walks back. The crowd are up on their feet. Respect. He went for another big six but hit it skywards ... high .. very high ... but Watson ran in from long-on to steady himself under the ball ...
leans forward to drive through mid-off
short in length, drifting to the thigh pad, Chanders tries to glance it away, misses but the ball runs off the thigh to the fine-leg boundary
angled across Xavier who taps it to point
gets forward to punch a length delivery to mid-off
Xavier chips to mid-off and takes the long walk back to the hutch. Hopes back pedaled before leaping behind to hold on to a sharp catch.
moves forward to cream a fullish delivery past mid-on for a fine boundary. Just four more now.
down the leg side and just 3 more now
And a wide outside off now! Sars has been moving around the crease and that seems to have unsettled Mitch

That's the game. West Indians celebrate in the dug out. It was full and outside off, Sarwan lunged at it and got a thick profitable edge down to third man boundary. What a fine win for the men from Caribbean. Though their ground fielding was pretty poor, their bowlers did a fine job to restrict Australia before Gayle and Fletcher hunted down the total in some style
